Clarification based on context: This is his Dad's house as referenced by the first page. Though I don't think his dad dressing the young Fondue was meant as him witnessing the assault, What I think happened is there was some sort of abuse done to Fondue by her parents, they get arrested, she gets relocated to his Dad's house, this explains the problems going away and his guilt is probably just 2nd hand guilt hearing what happened through his Dad explaining the situation. The scene of his Dad dressing her is probably meant to be the day she got moved to their house and his Dad just getting her some temporary clothes. Though the only liking her for her looks thing is weird, idk, this was just my interpretation of what I think happened based on context clues

This is just an idle thought, but I think it was his father that assaulted the girl. On page 2 it's the same room layout, but in different time. I believe it's the grandparents' house of his father's side, so it's possible that his father was the one who did it when they visited some time in the past. That's why she says "I'm not interested in trying to help you clear up your sense of guilt." 

It's possible that he feels guilty about the whole affair and wants to make amend, like offering to come with him for the job offer. And I have an inkling that when he says "The issues that had to be resolved went away as we got older," he's trying to imply that his father has passed away and the problems "went away" with him. 

Then again, this is just an idle thought. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
